for an

te the tests, or in which the
 tests are run?

e I write the code to make it pass.

 particular order, and so ensure
 they are completely independent from one =

 First of all, thanks for your tips!

 As my second question is =
concerned: I did not mean the order of
writing the tests nor the order of r=
unning the tests (this is the
responsibility of JUnit framework).

I meant =
the following:
 I cannot do a TDD this time, because I have already an exis=
ting
project with about 100 production classes (and some time to learn and
=
exercise JUnit tests).
So which class shall I start with to write JUnit tes=
ts for? Perhaps 
it is worth starting with a class that does not have any c=
ollaborators
or only ones that are already tested in a previous "test phase=
".
